page.title: 15LANDSCAPE,SAUNDERSFOOT.
page.content: The coastline to and from Saundersfoot is part of the Pembrokeshire Coast National Park.This is unique among the 10 National parks in Wales and England in that it is the only one that is predominantly coastal. The term "NATIONAL" is not meant to imply that the land in the National park is state owned, in fact, only about 9% of land within the Pembs Coast National park is in some form of public ownership. The rest is private property. The Coastal Footpath is a beautiful walk stretching 180 miles from Cardigan to Amroth.Many people attempt the walk,staying at Youth Hostels or camping on the way.
